lead_paragraph: The Ghanaian sprinter Aziz Zakari has been suspended by the International Association of Athletics Federations after testing positive for the steroid stanozolol on April 29 at the I.A.A.F. Grand Prix in Dakar, Senegal. Zakari, 29, who has a career-best time of 9.99 seconds in the 100 meters, faces a two-year ban.
